ENGLISH: Pressure the UK to cede Newfoundland
Pressure the UK to cede Newfoundland
Offer to sell Labrador to Canada

The accession of Newfoundland & Labrador to our nation has taken a toll upon relations us and Canada. Canadian resentment of the British-defined Quebec-Labrador boundary line has also become more of a concern now that it forms an international boundary between sovereign nations.\n Canada would likely be amenable to us selling them the sparsely populated mainland Labrador in exchange for a monetary settlement and an expansion of their fishing rights in the area, as a method of repairing relations between our nations it may be worth considering.
REMOVE HASH FOR ACTIVE EVENTS AND OPTIONS

The former dominion of Newfoundland in northeastern North America has been ruled by direct British commission since its financial collapse in the 1930s. With the devastation of WWII impacting upon the Empire's remaining finances, it may be worth seeking an end to our financial oversight of the territory by ceding it to Canada or the USA.\nThe most diplomatic, but expensive, solution however would be to gauge the opinions of the territory's residents first through a referendum before deciding upon our course of action.

The former dominion of Newfoundland neighbouring us to the east has been ruled by direct British commission since its financial collapse in the 1930s. With the devastation of WWII impacting upon the Empire's remaining finances, Britain is attempting to seek an end to its financial oversight of the territory.\nShould we raise our interest with Britain towards having the territory become part of Canada?
Britain has agreed to transfer governance and sovereignty of Newfoundland to our nation.\nFrom this day forward Newfoundland will be a province of the confedaration of Canada.
